instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DEAD with Green Light
threads.message:
The board is clean, however <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> have a short to ground.
I inject V on that rail and nothing gets warm.

Can you guys help me on that?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DEAD with Green Light
threads.message:
Is already explained on the forum how to inject voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Do NOT do that again, before measure basics things...

Post exact value you get there.
Then check if any big coil gives the same value.
If yes, check if you get a value close to 000 betwen that coil and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
That means corresponding high-side MOSFET is shorted.
In this way you will never inject overvoltage into CPU.
Thing which you could already done now...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DEAD with Green Light
threads.message: Remove F7140 and see if the short is on pin 1 or pin 2. If pin 1, inject away. If pin 2, inspect the board for any of the tantalum capacitors showing goo leaking from them or a crack in any of them.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DEAD with Green Light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DEAD with Green Light
threads.message: Usually the big capacitors aside CPU get shorted, however inject voltaje on pin 2 from F7140 and see what gets hot...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DEAD with Green Light
threads.message: I did and nothing gets hot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DEAD with Green Light
threads.message: what is the resistance between pin 2 of F7140 and ground??? How much voltaje and amps are you injecting????

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> DEAD with Green Light
threads.message:
"Post exact value you get there.
Then check if any big coil gives the same value.
If yes, check if you get a value close to 000 betwen that coil and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
That means corresponding high-side MOSFET is shorted."
Why you people always inject voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> before checking that???
